text: Charles Kenneth Spears (March 12, 1938 â€“ November 6, 2020) was an American television editor, writer, and producer. He was the co-founder with Joe Ruby of television animation production company Ruby-Spears Productions. Spears and Ruby created Scooby-Doo, Dynomutt, Dog Wonder, and Jabberjaw. He was born in California. Spears died on November 6, 2020 from Lewy body dementia-related problems at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia with Lewy bodies Category:American television writers Category:American television producers Category:Writers from California
title: Ken Spears
